comments:
When trying to create a Java Project using the project wizard gives me the
following message:"Invalid project description" saying that the project overlaps
with other location. It does not matter which location for the project I choose.
I have tested:

* Having the workspace in the eclipse installation path.
* Having the workspace outside the eclipse installation.

En each case the wizard lets you to go further and shows the additional
configuration parameters classpath, lib and so on, but this is all, when you try
to finish the wizard the error appears again.

Follows the error log: 

org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceException: Invalid project description.

eclipse.buildId=M20050929-0840
java.fullversion=GNU libgcj 4.0.2 20050808 (prerelease) (Ubuntu 4.0.1-4ubuntu9)
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=ppc, WS=gtk, NL=ca_ES
Command-line arguments:  -os linux -ws gtk -arch ppc

This works for me... can you give the exact message when it says there is overlap?

Are you really running Linux on Macintosh hardware, or is the "Hardware"
category in bugzilla wrong?

I think I have found the problem. The issue itself seems to be related with th
e way gnome treats parameters in the shourcuts. It seems it was not taking the
-Dosgi.locking=none
parameter.

Today I have run it on a console session and I have been able to create a new
project.
